questions.question: What is the primary purpose of 'Mail Merge' in MS Word?
options: To merge two different files into one folder
To send the same letter/email to multiple recipients with personalized details
To combine audio and video files
questions.explanation: Mail Merge is designed to create a batch of documents that are personalized for each recipient (like a form letter).

questions.question: Which tab in MS Word is dedicated to the Mail Merge process?
questions.explanation: The Mailings tab contains all the commands needed to start, write, and finish a merge.

questions.question: In the context of Mail Merge, what is the 'Data Source'?
options: The main text of the letter
The file (e.g., Excel sheet) containing recipient information like Names and Addresses
questions.explanation: The Data Source is the database or list that provides the specific information (variables) to be plugged into the document.

questions.question: Which button would you click to verify how your document looks with actual data before printing?
questions.explanation: Preview Results replaces the merge fields (<<Name>>) with actual data from your recipient list so you can check for errors.

questions.question: What does the 'Greeting Line' command do?
options: Inserts a standard opening like 'Dear Mr. Smith,' with options for format
questions.explanation: The Greeting Line button provides a dialog box to set up formal or informal salutations automatically.

questions.question: If you want to print address stickers for 100 people, which Mail Merge option should you start with?
questions.explanation: The 'Labels' option allows you to select a specific sticker manufacturer layout and fill a page with addresses.

questions.question: When you insert a Merge Field into your document, how does it look?
questions.explanation: Standard Merge Fields in Word are enclosed in chevrons, looking like <<FieldName>>.

questions.question: Which option under 'Finish & Merge' creates a new Word document containing all the individual letters?
questions.explanation: 'Edit Individual Documents' merges the data and opens a huge new document containing every personalized letter, which you can then edit or save.

questions.question: Which of the following can be used as a Recipient List for Mail Merge?
options: A manually typed list in Word
questions.explanation: Word supports various data sources including Excel files, Outlook contact lists, and lists created directly within Word.

questions.question: What happens if you click 'Highlight Merge Fields'?
options: It applies a gray background to all inserted fields so they are easy to spot
questions.explanation: This feature visually highlights the dynamic fields to help you distinguish them from the static text.

questions.question: You need to send an email blast using Mail Merge. Which field is mandatory in your data source?
questions.explanation: To use the 'Send Email Messages' function, the data source must contain a valid Email Address for every recipient.

questions.question: In the 'Start Mail Merge' group, what is the function of 'Select Recipients'?
options: To choose or create the list of people who will receive the document
questions.explanation: This command connects your document to a specific database or list of people.

questions.question: What is the 'Address Block' used for?
options: To insert a pre-formatted set of address fields (Name, Street, City, etc.) at once
questions.explanation: Address Block is a composite field that inserts name and address details in a standard postal format.

questions.question: Which Digital Skill is crucial when sending bulk emails to ensure you are not marked as spam?
options: Using all caps in the subject line
Personalizing the content and having a clear unsubscribe option
questions.explanation: Personalization (via Mail Merge) and following anti-spam rules help improve email deliverability.

questions.question: When creating Labels, after inserting fields into the first label, which button must you click to fill the rest of the page?
questions.explanation: The 'Update Labels' button replicates the layout and fields from the first label to all other labels on the sheet.

questions.question: In Mail Merge rules, what does 'If...Then...Else' allow you to do?
options: Display specific text based on a condition (e.g., if City is 'Mumbai', show 'Local Delivery')
questions.explanation: Conditional logic allows you to vary the text shown based on the data values of the recipient.

questions.question: Which AI tool capability would be most useful before starting a Mail Merge for a job application?
options: AI Writing Assistant to proofread and optimize the cover letter text
questions.explanation: Using an AI writing assistant helps ensure the static content of your merged document is professional and error-free.

questions.question: Where is the 'Envelopes' button located if you just want to print a single envelope without a full merge?
questions.explanation: The Create group contains standalone buttons for Envelopes and Labels for single-use printing.

questions.question: What file format is commonly used to export contacts from Gmail or other systems to use in a Mail Merge?
questions.explanation: CSV files are the universal standard for exchanging list data between different email and database systems.

questions.question: Can you filter recipients (e.g., only send to people in 'Pune') after selecting a list?
options: No, you must send to everyone
Yes, using the 'Edit Recipient List' option
Yes, but you have to delete them from Excel first
questions.explanation: 'Edit Recipient List' allows you to sort, filter, and uncheck specific individuals before finalizing the merge.
